Mesh

class pyrit.mesh.Mesh(node: ndarray, elem2node: ndarray)

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for mesh object.

Notes

build a geometry and controls an external meshing algorithm (gmsh).

Constructor for the abstract class Mesh.

Return type

None.

Methods

boundary_elements

Returns an array with the indices of the entities at the boundary

calc_edge_length

Computes the length of every edge.

calc_face_area

Computes the length of every edge.

calc_node2elem

Calculates the node-to-element relation.

calc_tet_volume

Computes the volume of every tetrahedron

find_elemidx

Return the index of the element a given coordinate is located in.

find_nodeidx

Return the index of the node closest to a given coordinate.

value_per_element

Return a vector with one value per element.

abstract find_elemidx(coordinates: ndarray) → ndarray

Return the index of the element a given coordinate is located in.

In the unlikely event that a coordinate is exactly on a node or an edge and thus, multiple elements have same shares in the coordinate, the element with the lowest index is returned.

Parameters

coordinates (array_like) – Matrix of coordinates (or single coordinate) for which to find the element indices. Each row of ‘cd’ represents one coordinate.

Returns

array of element indices

Return type

np.ndarray

abstract find_nodeidx(coordinates: ndarray) → ndarray

Return the index of the node closest to a given coordinate.

Choses the closest node based on Euclidian distance. In the unlikely event that a coordinate has numerically exact distances to nodes, the node with the lowest index is returned.

Parameters

coordinates (np.ndarray) – Matrix of coordinates (or single coordinate) for which to find the closest node(s). Each row of ‘cd’ represents one coordinate.

Returns

single index or array of node indices

Return type

np.ndarray

static calc_edge_length(edge2node: ndarray, node: ndarray) → ndarray

Computes the length of every edge.

Parameters

  • edge2node (np.ndarray) – (E,2) array. E elements.

  • node (np.ndarray) – (N,K) array. N nodes. K are the number of coordinated of one node and depends on the mesh.

Returns

(E,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

static calc_face_area(face2node: ndarray, node: ndarray) → ndarray

Computes the length of every edge.

Parameters

  • face2node (np.ndarray) – (F,3) array. F faces.

  • node (np.ndarray) – (N,K) array. N nodes. K is the number of coordinates of one node and depends on the mesh.

Returns

(F,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

static calc_tet_volume(tet2node: ndarray, node: ndarray) → ndarray

Computes the volume of every tetrahedron

Parameters

  • tet2node (np.ndarray) – (T,4) array. T tetradedra

  • node (np.ndarray) – (N,3) array. N nodes

Returns

(T,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

static calc_node2elem(elem2node: ndarray, num_node: int) → List[List[int]]

Calculates the node-to-element relation.

Parameters

  • elem2node (np.ndarray) – (T,3) array with 3 nodes per Element

  • num_node (int) – The number of nodes

Return type

List[List[int]]

value_per_element(regions: Regions, materials: Materials, prop_class: Type[MatProperty])

Return a vector with one value per element.

Evaluates the attribute elem2regi and returns a vector with the value of the given material property of the regions’ material.

Parameters

  • regions (Regions) – A regions object.

  • materials (Materials) – A materials object.

  • prop_class (Type[MatProperty]) – A class of MatProperty.

Returns

value_per_element – A vector with one value per element.

Return type

ndarray

abstract boundary_elements() → ndarray

Returns an array with the indices of the entities at the boundary
